item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens
item.description: Top News Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens 20 hours ago Indian stock markets ended negative, with Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both down 0.32%. Market breadth favored decliners, with 2,382 stocks falling versus 2,166 advancing. IndiGo's operational crisis, Biocon's biologics consolidation, ICICI Bank's stake increase in its AMC, Infosys' Vietnam expansion, and Pine Labs' AI-powered bill pay feature were key highlights. The cautious sentiment was influenced by various corporate developments and global cues.

item.title: Vivimed Labs Limited Trading Suspension Revoked by BSE and NSE, Trading to Resume December 18
item.description: Vivimed Labs Limited Trading Suspension Revoked by BSE and NSE, Trading to Resume December 18 26 minutes ago Vivimed Labs Limited announces that BSE and NSE have officially revoked the trading suspension for its equity shares, effective December 18, 2025. The company successfully addressed previous SEBI (LODR) Regulations non-compliances and will resume trading in Trade for Trade category under T group. This development reinstates liquidity and price discovery for shareholders after the compliance period.

item.title: Bondada Engineering Reports 107% Revenue Surge, Files Official BSE Update
item.description: Bondada Engineering Reports 107% Revenue Surge, Files Official BSE Update 39 minutes ago Bondada Engineering achieved exceptional 107% consolidated revenue growth as of November 2025, officially communicated through BSE filing on December 11, 2025. The infrastructure company surpassed previous year's total turnover while outlining strategic commitments to enhance stakeholder value, strengthen market presence, and leverage emerging business opportunities through disciplined execution and customer-centric delivery.

item.title: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price
item.description: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price 16 hours ago Vidya Wires Limited debuted on BSE at ₹52.13 per share, trading above its IPO issue price of ₹52.00. The listing reflects a modest premium of ₹0.13, representing approximately 0.25% gains over the offer price. The successful market debut enables regular trading of the company's shares on the exchange.
